record.text: Often times the source data it references is outdated or just outright made up, making me waste time chasing down a solution that is no longer relevant or never existed at all. I expect this bubble to burst sooner than later.

Copilot has been a useful timesaver for me. But that’s all it is, a timesaver, but only when doing very specific tasks for my job. Writing some framework code for me with very specific parameters? It amazes. Asking it to help me troubleshoot something? It’s hit or miss.

record.text: Anyway Oof ouch pain. Good night

I think it's funny that Microsoft named a shit search bot after Cortana; and then when AI chat bots became a thing, they killed her off and called their slopbot Copilot instead of naming it after their very famous fictional AI entity

✨🌱 Just a bunch of lil' guys  🌱✨

#pikmin

Dang… Ofc I boofed the last skeet. 

*And with the fact that anyone can now do this…, I don’t think I’ll be in software much longer.

I can finish my work a lot faster and that’s pretty cool but at the end of the day I feel like I cheated. And that anyone can do this with this technology. I don’t think I’ll be in software much longer…

Not necessarily because I want to, but because I have to. And to be honest, it actually really helps a lot. Instead of staring at my screen for 30 minutes to fix a problem, I can just tell copilot what it’s doing or click on the exception and it will fix the code for me. It’s kind of incredible.
Celery soup is a non-sexy way to eat celery. As much as I love soup, it's one of the least sexy foods

良いテストとはなんだろう？ - （good code, bad codeより）
開発における自動テストは難しく哲学的な側面を持つが、良いテストの原則に立ち返ることで妥当な判断が可能になる。
良いテストの五原則は、①破損を正確に検出する、②実装の詳細にとらわれない、③良く説明された失敗、④わかりやすいテストコード、⑤簡単かつ迅速な実行である。
これらの原則に基づき、何をテストすべきか、どこまでテストすべきかを試行錯誤することは、後々の開発負担を軽減し、より良いコード設計へと繋がる。
（179文字）

record.text:
This isn't exactly "hallucination", because somewhere in there Grok actually states it has not read the material.

But I have been taken aback about how much material it can make up about stuff it has not read!

Personally, I get a bit upset at these people who feel compelled to share they have Long Covid and are going to get vaccines...  It's not like I can just explain to them that they are suffering from vaxx effects. Who are they going to believe, somebody on BlueSky or their doctor? They just insult.

Further, the patient explains "This has to be conspiracy theory, because I didn't read about this in NYT, WaPo, and all these health websites I visit. I am going to get more vaccines tomorrow, my doctor says the brain fog and tiredness is from Covid and more vaccines will help."

What do you say?

Genuine question guys. 

We all know what the answer is when it comes to AI art (which is trash btw). But what do we all think of writing AI, say for the purpose of randomizing a character? I won't lie I've used grok to generate a quick backstory for an rp character and it works well.
Woke up, checked Bsky and this is the first thing I saw. I didn't think I needed this in my life but apparently I did.
Of course it didn't thumbnail preview properly... Here is a pic in case you don't trust the link. Girl finds baby tanuki with sign saying "please take me home"

Few are building actual personalities.

You’re not burned out.

AI-Enabled Influence Operation Against Iran

Citizen Lab has uncovered a coordinated AI-enabled influence operation against the Iranian government, probably conducted by Israel.

Key Findings

A coordinated network of more than 50 inauthentic X profiles is conducting an AI-enabled influe…

#ai #news

external.description:
Citizen Lab has uncovered a coordinated AI-enabled influence operation against the Iranian government, probably conducted by Israel.

Key Findings

A coordinated network of more than 50 inauthentic X profiles is conducting an AI-enabled influence operation. The network, which we refer to as “PRISONBREAK,” is spreading narratives inciting Iranian audiences to revolt against the Islamic Republic of Iran.
While the network was created in 2023, almost all of its activity was conducted starting in January 2025, and continues to the present day.
The profiles’ activity appears to have been synchronized, at least in part, with the military campaign that the Israel Defense Forces conducted against Iranian targets in June 2025.
...
external.title: AI-Enabled Influence Operation Against Iran

아이스크림미디어(461300)는 대한민국의 에듀테크 전문기업,

record.text: What a movie.

obviously i am not the first person to make these observations, plenty of science fiction has done this. but reading the posts of people who are hardcore in the “ai industry” is very scary. you are all evil

striving for “AGI” is deeply fucked up to me. you want to create a sentient existence so it can be your servant? arguing something like chatgpt is already there is laughable but if *was* there the implication is that it’s actually ok and awesome to have a sentient slave robot cuz uhh Productivity

i don’t think there is some intrinsic soul to humanity that could NEVER EVER be recreated. i believe that making true artificial intelligence is theoretically possible. i also think it shouldn’t happen on like a moral level

OpenAI still runs like a huge scam. 6GW deal for a financially unsustained product that legit nets money from promotions to try it and not so much need it. ChatGPT rn is about as justifiable as the actual purpose to an iPad.

Spotify révolutionne l’écoute en France : Lossless disponible et intégration de ChatGPT pour créer des playlists

Spotify vient de franchir une étape décisive dans le streaming musical. Après des années d’attente, le service propose enfin l’audio lossless en France, offrant une qualité sonore…

external.description: Spotify vient de franchir une étape décisive dans le streaming musical. Après des années d’attente, le service propose enfin l’audio lossless en France, offrant une qualité sonore équivalente à celle d’un studio d’enregistrement. Mais ce n’est pas tout : Spotify intègre désormais ChatGPT, permettant aux utilisateurs de générer des playlists personnalisées grâce à l’intelligence artificielle. Ce double changement représente une avancée majeure pour les utilisateurs, les artistes et l’industrie musicale.

Depuis plusieurs mois, une partie importante des utilisateurs de Google Maps subit un problème particulièrement frustrant : un bug qui résiste à toutes les tentatives de…

external.description: Depuis plusieurs mois, une partie importante des utilisateurs de Google Maps subit un problème particulièrement frustrant : un bug qui résiste à toutes les tentatives de correction, y compris… le changement de smartphone. Ce dysfonctionnement, qui semble lié à une mise à jour récente de l’application, perturbe profondément l’expérience utilisateur. Les itinéraires ne se calculent plus correctement, les trajets s’interrompent de manière aléatoire, et certaines fonctionnalités essentielles deviennent inutilisables.

record.text: Google Introduces AI-Powered Ransomware Detection in Drive for Desktop #desktopfileabuse #AIransomwaredetection #Drive

external.description:
Ransomware continues to be a growing cyber threat, capable of crippling businesses and disrupting personal lives. Losing access to vital files — from cherished family photos to financial records — can have devastating consequences. To tackle this, Google is introducing an AI-powered ransomware detection system for Drive for Desktop, designed to identify threats early and prevent large-scale data loss.
According to Google’s blog post, this new security layer for macOS and Windows continuously monitors for abnormal behavior, such as mass file encryption or corruption — common indicators of a ransomware attack. Unlike traditional antivirus tools that scan for malicious code, Google’s AI model focuses on how files change. When it detects unusual activity, even across a few files, it immediately halts syncing between the user’s device and the cloud. This pause prevents infected files from overwriting safe versions in Google Drive.
Once potential ransomware activity is detected, users receive desktop and email alerts and can access a new recovery interface within Drive. This interface allows them to restore their files to a clean, pre-attack state.
Ransomware remains a significant cybersecurity issue. In 2024, Mandiant reported that ransomware accounted for 21% of all intrusions, with an average cost per incident exceeding $5 million. Critical industries such as healthcare, education, retail, manufacturing, and government are particularly at risk. Google’s approach focuses on a crucial middle ground — between traditional antivirus prevention and post-attack recovery — where AI-driven early intervention can make a major difference.
Google emphasizes that this feature isn’t meant to replace antivirus or endpoint detection tools but to act as an additional safeguard. The system prioritizes commonly targeted file types like Office documents and PDFs, while native Google Docs and Sheets already benefit from built-in protection. Importantly, Google notes that it does not collect user data to train its AI models without explicit consent.
The AI ransomware detection feature is currently rolling out in open beta and will be available at no extra cost for most Google Workspace commercial customers. Individual users will also have access to file recovery tools for free. However, there’s no confirmation yet on whether similar protections will extend to Google Cloud Storage for enterprise users.

Google’s approach focuses on a crucial middle ground — between traditional antivirus prevention and post-attack recovery — where AI-driven early intervention can make a major difference.
Google emphasizes that this feature isn’t meant to replace antivirus or endpoint detection tools but to act as an additional safeguard. The system prioritizes commonly targeted file types like Office documents and PDFs, while native Google Docs and Sheets already benefit from built-in protection. Importantly, Google notes that it does not collect user data to train its AI models without explicit consent.
The AI ransomware detection feature is currently rolling out in open beta and will be available at no extra cost for most Google Workspace commercial customers. Individual users will also have access to file recovery tools for free. However, there’s no confirmation yet on whether similar protections will extend to Google Cloud Storage for enterprise users.
external.title: Google Introduces AI-Powered Ransomware Detection in Drive for Desktop

record.text: Social Event App Partiful Did Not Collect GPS Locations from Photos #Cloud #Data #Facebook

external.description:
Social event planning app Partiful, also known as "Facebook events for hot people," has replaced Facebook as the go-to place for sending party invites. However, like Facebook, Partiful also collects user data. 

The hosts can create online invitations in a retro style, which allows users to RSVP to events easily. The platform strives to be user-friendly and trendy, which has made the app No.9 on the Apple store, and Google has called it "the best app" of 2024. 

About Partiful



Partiful has recently developed into a Facebook-like social graph; it maps your friends and also friends of friends, what you do, where you go, and your contact numbers. When the app became famous, people started doubting its origins, alleging that the app had former employees of a data-mining company. TechCrunch, however, found that the app was not storing any location data from user-uploaded images, which include public profile pictures. 

Metadata in photos



The photos that you have on your phones have metadata, which consists of file size, date of capture. With videos, Metadata can include information such as the type of camera used, the settings, and latitude/longitude coordinates. TechCrunch discovered that anyone could use the developer tools in a web browser to get raw user profile photos access from Partiful’s back-end database on Google Firebase. 

About the bug



The flaw could have been problematic, as it could have exposed the location of a person’s profile photo if someone used Partiful. 

According to TechCrunch, “Some Partiful user profile photos contained highly granular location data that could be used to identify the person’s home or work, particularly in rural areas where individual homes are easier to distinguish on a map.”

It is a common norm for companies hosting user photos and videos to automatically remove metadata once uploaded to prevent privacy issues, such as Partiful.
external.title: Social Event App Partiful Did Not Collect GPS Locations from Photos

record.text: Government Operations in Chaos After South Korea Data Centre Fire #DataCentre #dataservicecompany #Government

external.description:
A massive disruption has struck South Korea’s government operations after a fire at a national data centre crippled hundreds of digital services, exposing serious weaknesses in the country’s technology infrastructure.

The incident occurred on Friday at the National Information Resources Service (NIRS) in Daejeon, where a blaze broke out during regular maintenance in a server room. The centre is a critical backbone of South Korea’s digital governance, hosting online platforms used by numerous ministries and agencies. Officials confirmed that out of 647 affected government systems, only 62 had been restored as of Monday.




Disruption Across Core Agencies

The outage has impacted major institutions, including Korea Customs, the National Police Agency, and the National Fire Agency, while even the Ministry of the Interior and Safety’s website remained inaccessible at the start of the week. With no clear timeline for complete restoration, authorities continue to work on recovering the systems.

Safety Minister Yun Ho-jung said that services were gradually coming back online, highlighting the return of Government24, the central online portal for public administration, and digital platforms operated by Korea Post. He acknowledged that the outage has caused widespread inconvenience and urged government bodies to cooperate to minimize disruptions as public demand for services increases during the work week.

President Lee Jae-myung publicly apologized for the breakdown, expressing concern that the government had not developed stronger contingency systems despite similar disruptions in the past. He directed ministries to urgently strengthen cybersecurity and propose emergency budgets for backup and recovery systems to prevent future incidents.

Preliminary findings suggest the fire began after a battery explosion in the facility. The battery, produced by LG Energy Solution and maintained by its affiliate LG CNS, was reportedly over ten years old and beyond its warranty period. According to the safety ministry, LG CNS had recommended replacement during an inspection last year, though the batteries continued to function at the time. The company has not issued further comments while investigations are underway.




Citizens Face Real-World Impact

The shutdown of online systems has forced residents to visit local offices in person for routine tasks such as obtaining ID cards, real estate documents, and school application forms.

A 25-year-old resident, Kim, said she had to delay travel plans to collect documents that were normally accessible online. Similarly, Kim Doo-han, 74, said he had to cancel his morning plans to visit a community service centre after hearing about the outage.

Officials working in these centres were seen noting down which services remained unavailable and manually assisting residents— a scene that highlighted the scale of the disruption and the country’s heavy reliance on digital governance.




Experts Warn of Complacency

Technology experts say the incident reflects insufficient preparedness for large-scale system failures. Lee Seong-yeob, a professor at Korea University, said national agencies should never experience such disruptions and urged the government to implement real-time backup and synchronization systems without delay.

As recovery efforts continue, authorities have cautioned that service interruptions could persist for several days. The government has promised to keep citizens informed as restoration progresses.
external.title: Government Operations in Chaos After South Korea Data Centre Fire

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Strange Disappearance of Brandy Wilson" on @Spreaker #brandy #disappearance #of #truecrime #wilson

external.description: The source provides an extensive overview of the unsolved 2002 disappearance of Brandy Wilson, a 24-year-old mother who vanished from her home in Colfax, Indiana, leaving behind her young children and all personal belongings except for $420 in cash. The episode details Brandy's life, including her challenging upbringing and her tumultuous marriage to Kenneth "Kenny" Wilson, who had a violent criminal history and became the primary suspect due to alleged domestic abuse and marital strain. It outlines the timeline of June 4, 2002, noting the lack of struggle or evidence, which perplexed early investigators, while also exploring the enduring suspicion placed on Kenny and various red herrings in the case. Finally, the source highlights the recent 2025 resurgence of the investigation thanks to the true-crime series Cold Justice and emphasizes the lasting impact of Brandy's vanishing on her family and the community.
external.title: The Strange Disappearance of Brandy Wilson

external.description: The source provides an extensive overview of the status and projected details of Shang-Chi 2, the anticipated sequel to the 2021 Marvel Cinematic Universe film. It explains that despite the first film being a critical and commercial success, the sequel has faced significant development hurdles and delays due to broader MCU recalibrations and industry strikes. The episode synthesizes updates from cast members, crew, and industry insiders to estimate a filming start in 2026 and a likely release window in late 2027 or 2028, placing it in Phase 6 or 7 of the MCU slate. Furthermore, the article explores the returning cast, including Simu Liu and Awkwafina, potential plot threads related to the Ten Rings' cosmic origins, and the sequel's overall importance to the MCU's ongoing Multiverse Saga.

external.description:
What if the person paying for a platonic hug isn't lonely, but a high-powered CEO? Or someone who is happily married? We're opening the file on one of the most misunderstood professions with 'Alex,' an anonymous professional cuddler.

In this deeply human episode, you'll discover the real reasons people seek professional touch—from successful women needing a temporary escape from command, to grieving widows renting a "temporary ghost." Alex reveals the structured, therapeutic process behind each session and explains why their service is less about loneliness and more about the profound lack of non-transactional, unconditional presence in our modern lives.

This is a look into the quiet ache of the 21st century and the surprisingly logical industry that has emerged to treat it.
external.title: DMV Secrets: The Checklist That Skips the Line & The SECRET Window

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "The Overthinker's SURVIVAL Guide: 3 Tools to Get Out of Your Head NOW." on @Spreaker #analysisparalysis #anxiety #anxietyrelief #getoutofyourhead #groundingtechniques #mentalclarity #mentalhealth #mentalwellness #mindfulness #mindsetmatters #mindsetshift #overthinking #selfcare

external.description:
Ever spend twenty minutes mentally re-writing a one-sentence email? Or lie awake at 3 AM replaying an awkward conversation from last week? Welcome to the club. You're not broken, you're just being haunted by "invisible bears."

In this episode, we expose overthinking for what it is: your ancient survival brain treating a typo like a saber-toothed tiger. We reveal how this mental glitch, designed for real threats, is misfiring in our modern world, trapping you in unproductive negative thought loops and costing you your time, energy, and creativity.

This isn't just about understanding the "why." This is your practical toolkit for fighting back. We'll give you a simple, three-part strategy to escape your own head:
Ground Yourself: Learn powerful grounding techniques to instantly pull yourself out of the anxiety spiral and back into the present moment.
Set Mental Boundaries: Discover how to put a time limit on your worries, so you control your thoughts—not the other way around.
Embrace "Good Enough": We'll show you how to defeat perfectionism and why prioritizing action over impossible standards is the secret to getting unstuck.

This is your official permission slip to stop letting the invisible bears run your life.

Ready to quiet the noise and reclaim your mental peace? Hit play, subscribe, and share this with a fellow overthinker. Let's get out of our heads, together.
external.title: The Overthinker's SURVIVAL Guide: 3 Tools to Get Out of Your Head NOW.

"The REAL State of AI: Separating the HYPE from the TERRIFYING Reality" on @Spreaker #agi #ai #aiprogress #artificialintelligence #automation #careeradvice #exponentialgrowth #futureofai #futureofwork #futureskills #gpt5 #innovation #machinelearning #productivity #science #tech

external.description:
Think AI is just a clever chatbot that's good at writing emails? That's what they want you to think. The truth is, we are in the middle of an exponential AI growth curve, and most people have no idea how fast the ground is shifting beneath their feet.

In this episode, we pull back the curtain on the real state of AI progress. We reveal the story of how GPT-5 recently provided a key, non-obvious step in a complex mathematical proof—a feat of creative problem-solving that signals a new era of AI in science. This isn't about AI replacing humans; it's about AI accelerating human discovery at a rate we've never seen before.

We'll break down the "doubling effect" that experts are seeing, where an AI's ability to complete complex, multi-step tasks is improving at a blistering pace. This isn't a slow creep; it's an intelligence explosion happening in real-time, and it's on a collision course with every industry on the planet.

Finally, we explore the massive economic impact of AI and answer the question everyone is asking: "Will AI take my job?" The answer is more surprising than you think. We argue that the most valuable human skill of the future won't be technical execution, but something called "opportunity judgment"—the uniquely human ability to guide, question, and iterate with these powerful new tools.

This isn't a podcast about the future; it's about the reality of right now.

The intelligence revolution is here. Hit play to understand your place in it, and share this with one person who needs to be prepared for what's coming next.
external.title: The REAL State of AI: Separating the HYPE from the TERRIFYING Reality
